Ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs; 1/2 cup plain yogurt; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 1/2 cup chopped onions; 1/4 cup cashews; 1/4 cup grated coconut; 1 teaspoon ground cumin; 1 teaspoon ground coriander; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger garlic paste, and salt. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. In a blender, combine chopped onions, cashews, grated coconut, ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Blend into a smooth paste. Heat oil in a pan. Add the spice paste and sauté until the oil separates. Add marinated chicken and cook until it's no longer pink. Pour in water and simmer until the chicken is cooked and the gravy thickens. Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice or naan.

Ingredients: 1 cup paneer (cottage cheese) cubes; 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 1/4 cup cashews; 1/4 cup milk; 2 tablespoons butter; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon garam masala; 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander; 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin; 1/4 teaspoon turmeric powder; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: Grind cashews and milk into a smooth paste. Heat butter in a pan. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Stir in ginger garlic paste and cook for a minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. Add red chili powder, garam masala, ground coriander, ground cumin, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. Add the cashew-milk paste and cook until the gravy thickens. Add paneer cubes and simmer for 2-3 minutes. Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with naan or rice.

Ingredients: For the Dosa Batter: 2 cups parboiled rice; 1/2 cup urad dal (black gram); 1/2 teaspoon fenugreek seeds; Water (as needed); Salt to taste; For the Masala Filling: 2 cups boiled and mashed potatoes; 1/2 cup chopped onions; 1/4 cup chopped green chilies; 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds; 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1/2 teaspoon urad dal; 1/2 teaspoon chana dal; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon asafoetida (hing); 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Oil for greasing dosa; Coconut chutney and sambar for serving
Process: Dosa Batter: Soak rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds in water for 4-5 hours. Grind into a smooth batter. Add salt and water if needed. Let it ferment overnight. Masala Filling: Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, urad dal, and chana dal. Let them splutter. Add asafoetida and chopped onions. Sauté until onions are translucent. Add chopped green chilies, turmeric powder, and salt. Stir in boiled and mashed potatoes. Cook for a few minutes. Making Dosas: Heat a non-stick griddle or dosa pan. Grease it with oil. Pour a ladle of dosa batter and spread it thinly. Cook until the dosa is crisp and golden. Place a portion of the masala filling on one side of the dosa and fold it. Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

Ingredients: 2 cups Basmati rice; 2 tablespoons ghee; 1 onion, thinly sliced; 1/2 cup mixed vegetables (peas, carrots, corn); 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon powder; 1/2 teaspoon cardamom pods; 1/4 cup cashews; 4 cups water; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: Rinse and soak Basmati rice in water for 30 minutes, then drain. Heat ghee in a large pot. Add cumin seeds, cinnamon powder, and cardamom pods. Sauté for a minute. Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown. Stir in mixed vegetables and cashews. Cook for a few minutes. Add soaked and drained rice. Mix well. Pour in water and add salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes until rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed. Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot.

Ingredients: For the Gobi (Cauliflower) Fritters: 2 cups cauliflower florets; 1/2 cup all-purpose flour; 1/4 cup cornstarch; 1 teaspoon ginger garlic paste; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1/4 teaspoon black pepper; Water (as needed); Salt to taste; Oil for frying; For the Manchurian Sauce: 1 onion, finely chopped; 1 bell pepper, finely chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1 tablespoon ginger, minced; 2 tablespoons soy sauce; 1 tablespoon tomato ketchup; 1 teaspoon red chili sauce (adjust to taste); 1 teaspoon vinegar; 1 teaspoon sugar; 1/2 teaspoon black pepper; 1/2 teaspoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water; Chopped spring onions for garnish
Process: Gobi Fritters: In a bowl, combine all-purpose flour, cornstarch, ginger garlic paste, red chili powder, black pepper, and salt. Add water to form a batter. Dip cauliflower florets in the batter and deep fry until golden brown. Manchurian Sauce: Heat oil in a pan. Add minced garlic and ginger. Sauté for a minute. Add chopped onions and bell peppers. Cook until they turn soft. Stir in soy sauce, tomato ketchup, red chili sauce, vinegar, sugar, black pepper, and salt. Add cornstarch-water mixture to thicken the sauce. Add fried cauliflower florets and toss to coat in the sauce. Garnish with chopped spring onions. Serve hot.

Ingredients: 2 cups okra (bhindi), washed, dried, and sliced; 1 onion, finely chopped; 1 tomato, chopped; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 1 green chili, chopped (adjust to taste); 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste); 1 teaspoon ground cumin; 1 teaspoon ground coriander; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Stir in ginger garlic paste and green chili. Cook for a minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, ground cumin, ground coriander, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. Add sliced okra and cook until they are tender and slightly crispy. Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with roti or rice.

Ingredients: 2 cups Basmati rice; 1 pound chicken, cut into pieces; 1/2 cup plain yogurt; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 1 teaspoon ground cumin; 1 teaspoon ground coriander; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; Salt to taste; 2 tablespoons ghee; 1 onion, thinly sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 1/2 cup chopped mint leaves; 1/2 cup chopped cilantro; 2 tablespoons fried onions (for garnish); Saffron strands soaked in milk (for garnish)
Process: Rinse and soak Basmati rice in water for 30 minutes, then drain. Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger garlic paste, ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Heat ghee in a large pot. Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown. Stir in chopped tomatoes, mint leaves, and cilantro. Cook until tomatoes turn soft. Add marinated chicken and cook until it's no longer pink. Layer the rice over the chicken mixture. Sprinkle fried onions and saffron-soaked milk on top. Cover and cook on low heat for 20-25 minutes until rice is cooked and flavors meld together. Serve hot.

Ingredients: 1 pound mutton pieces; 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 1/2 cup plain yogurt; 1 teaspoon ground cumin; 1 teaspoon ground coriander; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste); 1 teaspoon garam masala; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: Marinate mutton pieces with yogurt, ginger garlic paste, ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Heat oil in a pressure cooker or heavy-bottomed pot. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Stir in chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. Add marinated mutton and cook until it's browned. Add water and pressure cook for 4-5 whistles or simmer until mutton is tender. Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice or naan.

Ingredients: 2 cups Basmati rice; 2 tablespoons ghee; 1 onion, thinly sliced; 1/2 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans, corn); 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon powder; 1/2 teaspoon cardamom pods; 1/4 cup cashews; 4 cups water; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: Rinse and soak Basmati rice in water for 30 minutes, then drain. Heat ghee in a large pot. Add cumin seeds, cinnamon powder, and cardamom pods. Sauté for a minute. Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown. Stir in mixed vegetables and cashews. Cook for a few minutes. Add soaked and drained rice. Mix well. Pour in water and add salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes until rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed. Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot.

Ingredients: 4 eggs, hard-boiled and peeled; 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 1/2 cup plain yogurt; 1 teaspoon ground cumin; 1 teaspoon ground coriander; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste); 1 teaspoon garam masala; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: Heat oil in a pan. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Stir in ginger garlic paste and cook for a minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. Add ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. Whisk yogurt and add it to the pan. Simmer for a few minutes. Cut hard-boiled eggs in half and add them to the curry. Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice or naan.

Ingredients: 2 large flour tortillas; 1 cup grated cheddar cheese; 1 cup cooked black beans; 1 cup diced bell peppers (red, green, yellow); 1/2 cup diced red onion; 1/2 cup corn kernels; 1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro; 1 teaspoon chili powder; 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder; Salt and pepper to taste; Cooking spray; Sour cream and salsa for serving
Process: In a bowl, combine black beans, diced bell peppers, red onion, corn kernels, chopped cilantro, chili powder, cumin powder, salt, and pepper. Place one tortilla in a heated skillet or griddle. Sprinkle half of the grated cheddar cheese evenly over the tortilla. Spread the veggie mixture evenly over the cheese. Top with the remaining cheese and the other tortilla. Cook until the bottom tortilla is crispy and golden. Carefully flip the quesadilla and cook the other side until crispy and the cheese is melted. Remove from heat and cut into wedges. Serve hot with sour cream and salsa.

Ingredients: 1 cup red lentils, washed and drained; 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 carrots, diced; 2 celery stalks, diced; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1 teaspoon ground cumin; 1 teaspoon ground coriander; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili flakes (adjust to taste); 8 cups vegetable broth; 2 tablespoons olive oil; Salt and pepper to taste; Fresh lemon juice for garnish
Process: Heat olive oil in a large pot. Add chopped onions, carrots, and celery. Sauté until the vegetables are tender. Stir in minced garlic, ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, and red chili flakes. Cook for a minute. Add red lentils and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes until lentils are soft and cooked through. Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth. Season with salt, pepper, and fresh lemon juice. Serve hot.

Ingredients: 8 ounces pasta (linguine or spaghetti); 1 cup broccoli florets; 1/2 cup diced bell peppers (red, green, yellow); 1/2 cup diced zucchini; 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved; 1/4 cup sliced black olives; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 2 tablespoons olive oil; 1/2 cup heavy cream; 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese; Salt and pepper to taste; Chopped fresh basil for garnish
Process: Cook pasta according to package instructions. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté for a minute. Add broccoli florets, bell peppers, and zucchini. Cook until the vegetables are tender. Stir in cherry tomatoes and black olives. Pour in heavy cream and grated Parmesan cheese. Cook until the sauce thickens. Season with salt and pepper. Toss the cooked pasta with the sauce and vegetables. Garnish with chopped fresh basil. Serve hot.

Ingredients: 8 ounces linguine or spaghetti; 1/2 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined; 2 tablespoons unsalted butter; 2 tablespoons olive oil; 4 cloves garlic, minced; 1/4 cup white wine; Juice of 1 lemon; Zest of 1 lemon; 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley; Salt and black pepper to taste; Grated Parmesan cheese for garnish
Process: Cook pasta according to package instructions. Season shrimp with salt and black pepper. In a large skillet, heat olive oil and butter over medium-high heat. Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant. Add shrimp and cook until pink, about 2-3 minutes per side. Remove shrimp from the pan. Pour in white wine, lemon juice, and lemon zest. Cook for a few minutes to reduce the sauce. Return shrimp to the pan and add cooked pasta. Toss to coat in the sauce. Stir in chopped fresh parsley. Serve hot with grated Parmesan cheese.

Ingredients: 1 pound beef sirloin, thinly sliced; 2 cups broccoli florets; 1 bell pepper, sliced; 1 onion, sliced; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1/4 cup soy sauce; 2 tablespoons oyster sauce; 1 tablespoon brown sugar; 1 tablespoon cornstarch; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt and black pepper to taste; Cooked rice for serving
Process: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, oyster sauce, brown sugar, and cornstarch. Season sliced beef with salt and black pepper. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat. Add minced garlic and stir-fry for a minute. Add sliced beef and cook until browned. Remove beef from the pan. Add sliced onion, bell pepper, and broccoli florets. Stir-fry until vegetables are tender. Return cooked beef to the pan and pour in the sauce mixture. Cook until the sauce thickens and coats the beef and vegetables. Serve hot over cooked rice.

Ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs; 1/2 cup plain yogurt; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; Salt to taste; 2 tablespoons butter; 1 tablespoon vegetable oil; 2 onions, finely chopped; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon garam masala; 1 cup tomato puree; 1/2 cup heavy cream; 2 tablespoons dried fenugreek leaves (kasuri methi); Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger garlic paste, red chili powder, and salt. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Heat butter and oil in a pan. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger garlic paste, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for a few minutes. Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates. Add marinated chicken and cook until it's no longer pink. Pour in heavy cream and dried fenugreek leaves. Simmer for a few minutes. Season with salt and garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with naan or rice.

Ingredients: 2 cups cooked chickpeas; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; 1 large onion, finely chopped; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 2 tomatoes, finely chopped; 1 teaspoon ground cumin; 1 teaspoon ground coriander; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon garam masala; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: Heat oil in a pan. Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent. Add ginger garlic paste and cook for a few minutes until the raw smell disappears. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. Stir in ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. Add cooked chickpeas and simmer for about 10 minutes. Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice or naan.

Ingredients: 2 cups Basmati rice; 2 tablespoons ghee; 1 onion, thinly sliced; 1 green bell pepper, chopped; 1 red bell pepper, chopped; 1 carrot, diced; 1/2 cup green peas; 1/2 cup cauliflower florets; 1/2 cup green beans, chopped; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon garam masala; 1 teaspoon ground coriander; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 2 cups vegetable broth; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: Rinse and soak Basmati rice in water for 30 minutes, then drain. Heat ghee in a large pot. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown. Stir in ginger garlic paste and cook for a minute. Add chopped vegetables and sauté for 5 minutes. Add ground coriander, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. Add soaked and drained rice. Stir well to coat the rice with spices. Pour in vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes until rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed. Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot.

Ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces; 1 cup plain yogurt; 2 tablespoons ginger garlic paste; 1 teaspoon ground cumin; 1 teaspoon ground coriander; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; Salt to taste; 2 tablespoons butter; 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 tomatoes, pureed; 1 teaspoon garam masala; 1/2 cup heavy cream; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: Marinate the chicken with yogurt, ginger garlic paste, ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Grill or broil the marinated chicken until fully cooked. In a separate pan, heat butter and sauté chopped onions until golden brown. Add tomato puree and garam masala. Cook until the oil separates. Stir in grilled chicken and heavy cream. Simmer for a few minutes. Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with naan or rice.

Ingredients: 1 cup paneer (cottage cheese) cubes; 4 cups fresh spinach leaves, washed and blanched; 1 onion, finely chopped; 1 tomato, chopped; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 1 green chili, chopped (adjust to taste); 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon ground cumin; 1 teaspoon ground coriander; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: Blend blanched spinach leaves into a smooth paste. Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent. Stir in ginger garlic paste and green chili. Cook for a minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. Add ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. Add spinach puree and cook for 5-7 minutes. Add paneer cubes and simmer for 2-3 minutes. Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with naan or rice.

Ingredients: 2 cups cauliflower florets; 2 cups potatoes, diced; 1 onion, finely chopped; 1 tomato, chopped; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon ground cumin; 1 teaspoon ground coriander; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Stir in ginger garlic paste and cook for a minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, ground cumin, ground coriander, garam masala, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. Add cauliflower florets and diced potatoes. Mix well. Cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes until vegetables are tender. Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with naan or rice.

Ingredients: 1 pound boneless lamb, cubed; 2 onions, finely chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 1/2 cup plain yogurt; 1 teaspoon ground cumin; 1 teaspoon ground coriander; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste); 1 teaspoon garam masala; 4 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: Heat oil in a pan. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Stir in ginger garlic paste and cook for a minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. Add ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. Add cubed lamb and cook until it's no longer pink. Whisk yogurt and add it to the pan. Simmer for a few minutes. Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with naan or rice.

Ingredients: 4 bone-in chicken thighs; 1 cup plain yogurt; 2 tablespoons ginger garlic paste; 1 teaspoon ground cumin; 1 teaspoon ground coriander; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste); 1 teaspoon garam masala; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro and lemon wedges for garnish
Process: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger garlic paste, ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, vegetable oil, and salt. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Preheat a grill or broiler. Grill the marinated chicken until fully cooked and charred on the outside. Garnish with chopped cilantro and lemon wedges. Serve hot.

Ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour; 1/2 teaspoon baking soda; 1/2 teaspoon sugar; 1/2 teaspoon salt; 2 tablespoons plain yogurt; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; 1/2 cup warm water (approximately); 2 tablespoons melted butter (for brushing); Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: In a bowl, combine all-purpose flour, baking soda, sugar, and salt. Add yogurt and vegetable oil. Mix well. Gradually add warm water to form a soft dough. Knead for 5-7 minutes. Cover and let the dough rest for 2 hours. Preheat a grill or tandoor. Divide the dough into small portions and roll each portion into an oval shape. Place the naan on the grill or tandoor and cook until puffed and lightly browned on both sides. Brush with melted butter and garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot.

Ingredients: For the Samosa Dough: 2 cups all-purpose flour; 1/4 cup vegetable oil; 1/2 teaspoon salt; Water (as needed); For the Samosa Filling: 2 cups boiled and mashed potatoes; 1/2 cup boiled green peas; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon mustard seeds; 1 teaspoon ginger garlic paste; 1 green chili, chopped (adjust to taste); 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1 teaspoon ground cumin; 1 teaspoon ground coriander; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste); 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Oil for frying
Process: Samosa Dough: In a bowl, combine all-purpose flour, vegetable oil, and salt. Gradually add water and knead into a smooth dough. Cover and let it rest for 30 minutes. Samosa Filling: Heat vegetable oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and mustard seeds. Let them splutter. Add ginger garlic paste and green chili. Cook for a minute. Stir in turmeric powder, ground cumin, ground coriander, red chili powder, and salt. Add mashed potatoes and boiled green peas. Mix well and cook for a few minutes. Assembling Samosas: Divide the dough into small portions and roll each portion into a thin oval shape. Cut each oval in half to form two semi-circles. Fold each semi-circle into a cone shape and seal the edges with water. Fill each cone with the potato-pea mixture. Seal the open edge to form a triangular samosa. Heat oil for frying and deep fry the samosas until golden brown. Serve hot with chutney or ketchup.

Ingredients: 4 salmon fillets; 2 tablespoons olive oil; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1 lemon, sliced; 1 teaspoon dried oregano; Salt and black pepper to taste; Chopped fresh parsley for garnish
Process: Brush salmon fillets with olive oil and minced garlic. Season with dried oregano, salt, and black pepper. Place lemon slices on top. Grill for 4-5 minutes per side until salmon flakes easily. Garnish with chopped fresh parsley. Serve hot with a side of steamed vegetables.

Ingredients: 4 ripe tomatoes, sliced; 1 cup fresh mozzarella cheese, sliced; 1/2 cup fresh basil leaves; 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar; 2 tablespoons olive oil; Salt and black pepper to taste
Process: Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on a plate, alternating with fresh basil leaves. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar and olive oil. Season with salt and black pepper. Serve as a refreshing salad.

Ingredients: 1 pie crust; 1 cup fresh spinach, chopped; 1 cup mushrooms, sliced; 1/2 cup grated cheddar cheese; 4 large eggs; 1 cup milk; Salt and black pepper to taste
Process: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a pie crust with chopped spinach and sliced mushrooms. Sprinkle grated cheddar cheese on top. In a bowl, whisk together eggs and milk. Season with salt and black pepper. Pour the egg mixture over the spinach, mushrooms, and cheese. Bake for 35-40 minutes until the quiche is set and golden brown. Let it cool slightly before slicing.

Ingredients: 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts; 1/2 cup teriyaki sauce; 1/4 cup soy sauce; 2 tablespoons honey; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1 teaspoon ginger, minced; Sesame seeds for garnish
Process: In a bowl, whisk together teriyaki sauce, soy sauce, honey, minced garlic, and minced ginger. Marinate chicken breasts in the sauce for 30 minutes. Grill or pan-sear chicken until fully cooked, brushing with marinade. Garnish with sesame seeds. Serve hot with steamed rice and vegetables.

Ingredients: 2 cups cooked black beans; 1 cup cooked kidney beans; 1 cup corn kernels; 1 onion, chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1 bell pepper, diced; 1 can diced tomatoes; 2 tablespoons chili powder; 1 teaspoon cumin; 1 teaspoon paprika; Salt and black pepper to taste; Chopped fresh cilantro for garnish
Process: In a large pot, sauté chopped onions, minced garlic, and diced bell pepper until softened. Stir in cooked black beans, kidney beans, and corn kernels. Add diced tomatoes and spices: chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and black pepper. Simmer for 20-30 minutes. Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro. Serve hot with tortilla chips or rice.

Ingredients: 1 pound ground beef; 1 packet taco seasoning; 1 cup shredded lettuce; 1 cup diced tomatoes; 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese; 1/4 cup diced onions; 1/4 cup sour cream; 8 small taco shells
Process: In a skillet, cook ground beef until browned. Drain excess fat and stir in taco seasoning as per package instructions. Assemble tacos by filling each shell with beef, shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, shredded cheddar cheese, diced onions, and a dollop of sour cream. Serve hot.

Ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, sliced; 1 bell pepper, sliced; 1 onion, sliced; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 2 tablespoons fajita seasoning; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Flour tortillas for serving
Process: In a skillet, heat vegetable oil and sauté sliced chicken until cooked through. Add sliced bell pepper, sliced onion, minced garlic, and fajita seasoning. Cook until vegetables are tender. Serve the chicken and vegetable mixture in warm flour tortillas.

Ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (broccoli, bell peppers, carrots, snap peas); 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms; 1/4 cup soy sauce; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1 teaspoon ginger, minced; 1 teaspoon sesame seeds; Salt and black pepper to taste; Cooked rice for serving
Process: Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet. Add minced garlic and ginger and stir-fry for a minute. Add mixed vegetables and sliced mushrooms. Stir-fry until vegetables are tender-crisp. Pour soy sauce over the vegetables and toss to coat. Season with salt, black pepper, and sesame seeds. Serve hot over cooked rice.

Ingredients: 8 ounces pasta (penne or spaghetti); 1 cup fresh basil leaves; 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese; 1/4 cup pine nuts; 2 cloves garlic; 1/4 cup olive oil; Salt and black pepper to taste
Process: Cook pasta according to package instructions. In a food processor, combine fresh basil, grated Parmesan cheese, pine nuts, garlic, olive oil, salt, and black pepper. Blend into a smooth pesto sauce. Toss cooked pasta with the pesto sauce. Serve hot.

Ingredients: 8 ounces fettuccine pasta; 1/2 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined; 2 cups broccoli florets; 1 cup heavy cream; 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese; 2 tablespoons unsalted butter; 2 cloves garlic, minced; Salt and black pepper to taste
Process: Cook fettuccine pasta according to package instructions, adding broccoli florets during the last 4 minutes of cooking. Drain and set aside. In a skillet, heat butter over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté for a minute. Add shrimp and cook until pink, about 2-3 minutes per side. Pour in heavy cream and grated Parmesan cheese. Cook until the sauce thickens. Season with salt and black pepper. Toss cooked pasta and broccoli in the Alfredo sauce. Serve hot.

Ingredients: 2 cups mixed roasted vegetables (zucchini, bell peppers, cherry tomatoes); 1 cup cooked quinoa; 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese; 2 tablespoons balsamic vinaigrette; 1 tablespoon olive oil; Salt and black pepper to taste; Fresh basil leaves for garnish
Process: Toss mixed roasted vegetables and cooked quinoa in a bowl. Drizzle with balsamic vinaigrette and olive oil. Season with salt and black pepper. Sprinkle crumbled feta cheese on top. Garnish with fresh basil leaves.

Ingredients: 8 ounces spaghetti; 4 slices bacon, chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 2 large eggs; 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese; Salt and black pepper to taste; Chopped fresh parsley for garnish
Process: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions. In a skillet, cook chopped bacon until crispy. Remove excess fat, leaving about 1 tablespoon in the skillet. Add minced garlic and sauté for a minute. In a bowl, whisk together eggs and grated Parmesan cheese. Drain cooked spaghetti and immediately toss it with the egg and cheese mixture in the skillet. Season with salt and black pepper. Garnish with chopped fresh parsley.

Ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts; 8 ounces fettuccine pasta; 1 cup heavy cream; 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese; 2 tablespoons unsalted butter; 2 cloves garlic, minced; Salt and black pepper to taste; Chopped fresh parsley for garnish
Process: Season chicken breasts with salt and black pepper. Grill or pan-sear until fully cooked. Slice into thin strips. Cook fettuccine pasta according to package instructions. In a skillet, heat butter over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté for a minute. Pour in heavy cream and grated Parmesan cheese. Cook until the sauce thickens. Toss cooked pasta with the Alfredo sauce and sliced chicken. Garnish with chopped fresh parsley.

Ingredients: 2 cups chopped cucumber; 2 cups chopped tomatoes; 1/2 cup sliced red onion; 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese; 1/4 cup Kalamata olives; 2 tablespoons olive oil; 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar; 1 teaspoon dried oregano; Salt and black pepper to taste; Fresh mint leaves for garnish
Process: In a large bowl, combine chopped cucumber, chopped tomatoes, sliced red onion, crumbled feta cheese, and Kalamata olives. Drizzle with olive oil and red wine vinegar. Season with dried oregano, salt, and black pepper. Toss to combine. Garnish with fresh mint leaves.

Ingredients: 1 pound beef sirloin, thinly sliced; 2 cups broccoli florets; 1/4 cup soy sauce; 2 tablespoons hoisin sauce; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1 teaspoon ginger, minced; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Sesame seeds for garnish; Cooked rice for serving
Process: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce and hoisin sauce. Marinate thinly sliced beef in the sauce for 15 minutes. In a wok or large skillet, heat vegetable oil over high heat. Stir-fry marinated beef until browned. Add minced garlic and minced ginger. Add broccoli florets and stir-fry until tender-crisp. Serve over cooked rice and garnish with sesame seeds.

Ingredients: 1 cauliflower head, riced; 1/2 cup grated mozzarella cheese; 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese; 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano; 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder; 2 eggs; Salt and black pepper to taste; Pizza sauce and toppings of your choice
Process: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Steam or microwave riced cauliflower until tender. Allow it to cool, then place it in a clean kitchen towel and squeeze out excess moisture. In a bowl, combine cauliflower, grated mozzarella cheese, grated Parmesan cheese, dried oregano, garlic powder, eggs, salt, and black pepper. Mix well. Press the cauliflower mixture onto a pizza pan, forming a crust. Bake for 12-15 minutes until golden brown. Add pizza sauce and your favorite toppings. Bake for an additional 10-12 minutes until cheese is bubbly.

Ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts; 6 cups chicken broth; 2 cups sliced carrots; 2 cups sliced celery; 1 cup chopped onion; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 2 cups egg noodles; 1 teaspoon dried thyme; Salt and black pepper to taste; Fresh parsley for garnish
Process: In a large pot, bring chicken broth to a boil. Add chicken breasts, sliced carrots, sliced celery, chopped onion, minced garlic, and dried thyme. Simmer until chicken is cooked through. Remove chicken, shred it, and return it to the pot. Add egg noodles and cook until tender. Season with salt and black pepper. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Ingredients: 8 ounces linguine pasta; 1/2 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 2 tablespoons unsalted butter; 2 tablespoons olive oil; 1/4 cup white wine; Juice of 1 lemon; 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley; Salt and black pepper to taste
Process: Cook linguine pasta according to package instructions. In a skillet, heat olive oil and unsalted butter over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté for a minute. Add large shrimp and cook until pink, about 2-3 minutes per side. Remove shrimp from the skillet. Pour in white wine and lemon juice. Simmer for a few minutes. Toss cooked linguine with the sauce. Add cooked shrimp and chopped fresh parsley. Season with salt and black pepper. Serve hot.

Ingredients: 4 large eggs; 1/4 cup diced bell peppers (red, green, yellow); 1/4 cup diced onions; 1/4 cup sliced mushrooms; 1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese; 1 tablespoon butter; Salt and black pepper to taste; Chopped fresh chives for garnish
Process: In a bowl, beat eggs and season with salt and black pepper. In a skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add diced bell peppers, diced onions, and sliced mushrooms. Sauté until vegetables are tender. Pour beaten eggs over the sautéed vegetables. Sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese on top. Cook until the edges are set. Fold the omelette in half and cook until fully set. Garnish with chopped fresh chives.

Ingredients: 2 ripe mangoes, diced; 1/2 cup diced red bell pepper; 1/4 cup diced red onion; 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro; Juice of 1 lime; 1/2 teaspoon chili powder; Salt and black pepper to taste
Process:
In a bowl, combine diced ripe mangoes, diced red bell pepper, diced red onion, chopped fresh cilantro, and juice of 1 lime. Season with chili powder, salt, and black pepper. Toss to combine. Serve as a refreshing salsa
Biryani"
column4: 2 cups Basmati rice; 1 pound chicken, mutton, or vegetables; 2 onions, thinly sliced; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 1/4 cup plain yogurt; 2 tablespoons ginger garlic paste; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon garam masala; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 4 cups chicken or vegetable broth; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro and fried onions for garnish
column5: 1. Rinse and soak Basmati rice in water for 30 minutes, then drain. 2. Heat vegetable oil in a large pot. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. 3. Add thinly sliced onions and sauté until golden brown. 4. Stir in ginger garlic paste and cook for a minute. 5. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. 6. Add chicken, mutton, or vegetables and sauté until lightly browned. 7. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. 8. Whisk plain yogurt and add it to the pot. Cook until the oil separates. 9. Add soaked and drained rice. Mix well. 10. Pour in chicken or vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes until rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed. 11. Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with chopped cilantro and fried onions. Serve hot.

Ingredients: 1 cup semolina (sooji); 1/4 cup all-purpose flour (maida); 1/2 cup boiled and mashed potatoes; 1/2 cup boiled chickpeas; 1/2 cup tamarind chutney; 1/4 cup mint-coriander chutney; 1 teaspoon chaat masala; 1 teaspoon roasted cumin powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; Salt to taste; Water for filling
Process: For the Puri Shells: 1. In a bowl, combine semolina and all-purpose flour. Add a pinch of salt and enough water to make a stiff dough. 2. Cover and let the dough rest for 30 minutes. 3. Pinch small portions of the dough and roll them into small balls. 4. Roll out each ball into a thin disc. 5. Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the discs until they puff up and turn golden brown. Remove and drain excess oil. For the Filling: 1. Make a hole in the center of each fried disc. 2. Stuff with boiled mashed potatoes and boiled chickpeas. 3. Pour tamarind chutney and mint-coriander chutney into each shell. 4. Sprinkle chaat masala, roasted cumin powder, red chili powder, and salt. 5. Dip each stuffed shell in water and serve immediately.

Ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour; 2 medium-sized potatoes, boiled and mashed; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; Salt to taste; Ghee or butter for cooking
Process: 1. In a bowl, combine whole wheat flour, cumin seeds, red chili powder, garam masala, turmeric powder, and salt. 2. Add boiled and mashed potatoes. Knead into a soft dough, adding water if needed. 3. Divide the dough into equal portions and roll them into balls. 4. Roll out each ball into a flat disc. 5. Heat a griddle or tava and cook the parathas with ghee or butter until golden brown on both sides. 6. Serve hot with yogurt or chutney.

Ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour; 1/4 cup plain yogurt; 1 teaspoon baking powder; 1/2 teaspoon baking soda; 1/4 teaspoon salt; 1 teaspoon sugar; 2 tablespoons ghee; 1/2 cup warm milk; Butter and chopped garlic for brushing
Process: 1. In a bowl, combine all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and sugar. 2. Add plain yogurt and ghee. Mix well. 3. Gradually add warm milk and knead into a soft dough. Cover and let it rest for 2 hours. 4. Divide the dough into small portions and roll them into balls. 5. Roll out each ball into an oval shape. 6. Heat a griddle or tava and cook the naan until puffed and browned on both sides. 7. Brush with butter and chopped garlic before serving.

Ingredients: 4 samosas (pre-made or homemade); 1 cup boiled chickpeas; 1/2 cup yogurt; 1/4 cup tamarind chutney; 1/4 cup mint-coriander chutney; 1 onion, finely chopped; 1 tomato, chopped; 1/4 cup sev (crispy chickpea noodles); 1 teaspoon chaat masala; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: 1. Crush or break the samosas into small pieces. 2. Arrange the samosa pieces on a plate. 3. Top with boiled chickpeas, yogurt, tamarind chutney, and mint-coriander chutney. 4. Sprinkle chopped onions, chopped tomatoes, and sev on top. 5. Season with chaat masala and red chili powder. 6. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve immediately.

Ingredients: 1 cup paneer (cottage cheese) cubes; 1/2 cup yogurt; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon garam masala; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder; 1/2 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon chaat masala; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Lemon wedges and onion rings for garnish
Process: 1. In a bowl, combine yogurt, ginger garlic paste, red chili powder, garam masala, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, chaat masala, vegetable oil, and salt. 2. Add paneer cubes and marinate for at least 1 hour. 3. Thread the marinated paneer cubes onto skewers. 4. Grill or broil the paneer skewers until charred and cooked through. 5. Garnish with lemon wedges and onion rings.

Ingredients: For Chole (Chickpea Curry): 2 cups cooked chickpeas; 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1 teaspoon garam masala; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder; 1/2 teaspoon coriander powder; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish For Bhature (Fried Bread): 2 cups all-purpose flour; 1/2 cup yogurt; 1/2 teaspoon baking soda; Salt to taste; Vegetable oil for frying
Process: For Chole (Chickpea Curry): 1. Heat vegetable oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. 2. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 3. Stir in ginger garlic paste and cook for a minute. 4. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. 5. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. 6. Add cooked chickpeas and simmer for about 10 minutes. 7. Garnish with chopped cilantro. For Bhature (Fried Bread): 1. In a bowl, combine all-purpose flour, yogurt, baking soda, and salt. 2. Knead into a soft dough. Cover and let it rest for 2 hours. 3. Divide the dough into small portions and roll them into balls. 4. Roll out each ball into a flat disc. 5. Heat vegetable oil in a deep pan and fry the bhature until they puff up and turn golden brown. 6. Serve hot with chole.

Ingredients: 2 cups rice; 1/2 cup urad dal (black gram); 1/2 teaspoon fenugreek seeds; Salt to taste; Vegetable oil for cooking
Process: 1. Rinse rice and urad dal separately and soak them along with fenugreek seeds in water for 6 hours or overnight. 2. Drain and grind into a smooth batter. Add salt and mix well. 3. Heat a griddle or dosa pan. Grease it with oil. 4. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the hot griddle and spread it into a thin circle. 5. Drizzle oil along the edges and cook until crispy and golden brown. 6. Serve hot with chutney and sambar.

Ingredients: For Koftas: 2 cups boiled and mashed potatoes; 1/2 cup crumbled paneer (cottage cheese); 2 tablespoons corn flour; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; Salt to taste; Vegetable oil for frying For Gravy: 1 cup tomato puree; 1 onion, finely chopped; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 1/2 cup cashew nuts, soaked and ground; 1/2 cup heavy cream; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder; 1/2 teaspoon coriander powder; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: For Koftas: 1. In a bowl, combine mashed potatoes, crumbled paneer, corn flour, garam masala, red chili powder, and salt. 2. Shape the mixture into round koftas and deep fry them until golden brown. For Gravy: 1. Heat vegetable oil in a pan. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 2. Stir in ginger garlic paste and cook for a minute. 3. Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates. 4. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. 5. Add cashew nut paste and heavy cream. Simmer for a few minutes. 6. Add fried koftas to the gravy and simmer for 2-3 minutes. 7. Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with chopped cilantro.

Ingredients: 1 pound chicken pieces; 1 cup yogurt; 2 onions, finely sliced; 1 tomato, chopped; 2 tablespoons ginger garlic paste; 1/2 cup cashew nuts, soaked; 1/2 cup cream; 1 teaspoon garam masala; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder; 1/2 teaspoon coriander powder; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: 1. Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. 2. Heat vegetable oil in a pan. Add finely sliced onions and sauté until caramelized. 3. Stir in chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. 4. Add marinated chicken and cook until it's no longer pink. 5. Grind soaked cashew nuts into a smooth paste. 6. Add cashew nut paste, cream, garam masala, cumin powder, and coriander powder to the chicken. Simmer for a few minutes. 7. Season with salt and garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice or naan.

Ingredients: 2 cups rice; 1/2 cup urad dal (black gram); 1/2 teaspoon fenugreek seeds; Salt to taste; Vegetable oil for cooking; Potato Masala (For Filling): 2 large potatoes, boiled and mashed; 1 onion, chopped; 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds; 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; Curry leaves; Salt to taste
Process: For Dosa Batter: 1. Rinse rice and urad dal separately and soak them along with fenugreek seeds in water for 6 hours or overnight. 2. Drain and grind into a smooth batter. Add salt and mix well. 3. Heat a griddle or dosa pan. Grease it with oil. 4. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the hot griddle and spread it into a thin circle. 5. Drizzle oil along the edges and cook until crispy and golden brown. 6. Serve hot with potato masala and chutney. For Potato Masala: 1. Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter. 2. Add cumin seeds, chopped onions, and curry leaves. Sauté until onions turn translucent. 3. Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. 4. Add boiled and mashed potatoes. Cook for a few minutes. 5. Serve as a filling for dosa.

Ingredients: For Vada: 4 medium-sized potatoes, boiled and mashed; 1 teaspoon mustard seeds; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; For Pav (Buns): 4 pav buns; 2 tablespoons garlic chutney; 2 tablespoons tamarind chutney; 2 tablespoons green chutney; Butter for toasting;
Process: For Vada: 1. Heat vegetable oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter. 2. Add cumin seeds and sauté for a minute. 3. Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. 4. Add mashed potatoes and salt. Mix well and cook for a few minutes. 5. Shape the potato mixture into round vadas and deep fry until golden brown. For Pav: 1. Slice pav buns in half. 2. Spread garlic chutney on one side and tamarind chutney on the other side. 3. Place a vada in between. 4. Toast the assembled pav in butter until crisp. 5. Serve hot with green chutney.

Ingredients: For Koftas: 1 cup paneer (cottage cheese) cubes; 1/2 cup spinach puree; 2 tablespoons corn flour; Salt to taste; Oil for frying; For Gravy: 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 1/2 cup cream; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder; 1/2 teaspoon coriander powder; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: For Koftas: 1. In a bowl, combine paneer cubes, spinach puree, corn flour, and salt. 2. Shape the mixture into round koftas and deep fry until golden brown. For Gravy: 1. Heat vegetable oil in a pan. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 2. Stir in ginger garlic paste and cook for a minute. 3. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. 4. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. 5. Add cream and garam masala. Simmer for a few minutes. 6. Place the fried koftas in the gravy. 7. Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with naan or rice.

Ingredients: 4 chicken leg quarters; 1 cup yogurt; 2 tablespoons ginger garlic paste; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1 teaspoon cumin powder; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1 teaspoon garam masala; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Lemon wedges and onion rings for garnish
Process: 1. Make deep cuts in the chicken pieces. 2. In a bowl, combine yogurt, ginger garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, vegetable oil, and salt. 3. Marinate the chicken with this mixture for at least 4 hours or overnight. 4. Preheat the oven to 450°F (230°C). 5. Place the marinated chicken on a baking tray and roast for 25-30 minutes or until cooked through and charred. 6. Garnish with lemon wedges and onion rings. Serve hot.

Ingredients: 1 cup paneer (cottage cheese) cubes; 2 onions, finely chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 1/2 cup cashew nuts, soaked and ground; 1/2 cup cream; 1 teaspoon garam masala; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder; 1/2 teaspoon coriander powder; 2 tablespoons butter; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: 1. Heat butter in a pan. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 2. Stir in ginger garlic paste and cook for a minute. 3. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. 4. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. 5. Add soaked and ground cashew nuts, cream, and garam masala. Simmer for a few minutes. 6. Add paneer cubes and cook for 2-3 minutes. 7. Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with naan or rice.

Ingredients: 2 large eggplants; 1 onion, finely chopped; 1 tomato, chopped; 1 green chili, chopped; 1 teaspoon ginger garlic paste; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder; 1/2 teaspoon coriander powder; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: 1. Roast the eggplants over an open flame or in the oven until the skin is charred and the flesh is soft. 2. Let them cool, then peel the skin and mash the flesh. 3. Heat vegetable oil in a pan. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 4. Stir in ginger garlic paste, chopped green chili, and chopped tomatoes. Cook until tomatoes turn soft. 5. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. 6. Add mashed eggplant and cook for 5-7 minutes. 7. Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with roti or rice.

Ingredients: 1 cup milk; 1/2 cup sugar; 1/2 cup water; 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder; A few saffron strands; 1 teaspoon rose water; 1/2 teaspoon lemon juice;
Process: 1. Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pan and add lemon juice. 2. When the milk curdles, strain it through a muslin cloth. 3. Gather the cloth and hang it to drain excess whey for about 30 minutes. 4. Knead the chenna (paneer) until smooth. 5. Divide it into small, equal-sized balls. 6. In another pan, mix sugar and water. 7. Bring it to a boil and add cardamom powder and saffron strands. 8. Add the chenna balls to the boiling syrup. 9. Cover and cook for 20-25 minutes. 10. Remove from heat, add rose water, and let it cool. 11. Serve chilled.

Ingredients: 1 cup milk powder; 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour; 1/4 teaspoon baking soda; 2 tablespoons ghee; Milk, as needed; Oil or ghee for frying; For Sugar Syrup: 1 cup sugar; 1 cup water; A few saffron strands; A pinch of cardamom powder;
Process: 1. In a bowl, combine milk powder, all-purpose flour, baking soda, and ghee. 2. Add milk gradually and knead into a soft dough. 3. Divide the dough into small portions and shape them into smooth balls. 4. Heat oil or ghee in a pan and deep fry the balls until golden brown. 5. In another pan, prepare the sugar syrup by boiling sugar and water. 6. Add saffron strands and cardamom powder to the syrup. 7. Remove the fried balls from oil and dip them into the sugar syrup. 8. Let them soak for a few hours. 9. Serve.

Ingredients: For Bhaji: 2 potatoes, boiled and mashed; 1/2 cup cauliflower florets, boiled and mashed; 1/2 cup green peas, boiled and mashed; 1/2 cup capsicum, finely chopped; 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste; 2 tablespoons pav bhaji masala; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 2 tablespoons butter; Salt to taste; For Pav: 4 pav buns; Butter for toasting; Chopped cilantro and chopped onions for garnish
Process: For Bhaji: 1. Heat butter in a pan. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 2. Stir in ginger garlic paste and cook for a minute. 3. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. 4. Add pav bhaji masala, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. 5. Add mashed potatoes, cauliflower, green peas, and capsicum. Mix well. 6. Cook for 10-15 minutes, mashing the vegetables while cooking. 7. For Pav: 1. Slice pav buns in half and toast them with butter. 2. Serve hot with bhaji, garnished with chopped cilantro and chopped onions.

Ingredients: For Dough: 2 cups all-purpose flour; Water, as needed; Salt to taste; For Filling: 2 cups finely chopped vegetables (cabbage, carrot, bell pepper); 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1-inch piece of ginger, minced; 1 green chili, minced; 1 teaspoon soy sauce; 1 teaspoon oil; Salt and pepper to taste
Process: For Dough: 1. In a bowl, mix all-purpose flour, water, and salt to make a soft dough. 2. Cover and let it rest for 30 minutes. For Filling: 1. Heat oil in a pan. Add minced garlic, ginger, and green chili. 2. Sauté for a minute, then add chopped onions and cook until translucent. 3. Add finely chopped vegetables and stir-fry until they are tender. 4. Add soy sauce, salt, and pepper. 5. Remove from heat and let it cool. To Make Momo: 1. Divide the dough into small portions and roll them into thin circles. 2. Place a spoonful of the vegetable filling in the center of each circle. 3. Fold the circle in half, creating a half-moon shape. 4. Pinch and pleat the edges to seal the momo. 5. Steam the momo for about 15-20 minutes until cooked. 6. Serve hot with dipping sauce.

Ingredients: For Dough: 2 cups all-purpose flour; Water, as needed; Salt to taste; For Filling: 1 cup ground chicken; 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1-inch piece of ginger, minced; 1 green chili, minced; 1 teaspoon soy sauce; 1 teaspoon oil; Salt and pepper to taste
Process: For Dough: 1. In a bowl, mix all-purpose flour, water, and salt to make a soft dough. 2. Cover and let it rest for 30 minutes. For Filling: 1. Heat oil in a pan. Add minced garlic, ginger, and green chili. 2. Sauté for a minute, then add chopped onions and cook until translucent. 3. Add ground chicken and stir-fry until cooked. 4. Add soy sauce, salt, and pepper. 5. Remove from heat and let it cool. To Make Momo: 1. Divide the dough into small portions and roll them into thin circles. 2. Place a spoonful of the chicken filling in the center of each circle. 3. Fold the circle in half, creating a half-moon shape. 4. Pinch and pleat the edges to seal the momo. 5. Steam the momo for about 15-20 minutes until cooked. 6. Serve hot with dipping sauce.

Ingredients: For Dough: 2 cups all-purpose flour; Water, as needed; Salt to taste; For Filling: 2 cups finely chopped vegetables (cabbage, carrot, bell pepper); 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1-inch piece of ginger, minced; 1 green chili, minced; 1 teaspoon soy sauce; 1 teaspoon oil; Salt and pepper to taste; Oil for deep frying
Process: For Dough: 1. In a bowl, mix all-purpose flour, water, and salt to make a soft dough. 2. Cover and let it rest for 30 minutes. For Filling: 1. Heat oil in a pan. Add minced garlic, ginger, and green chili. 2. Sauté for a minute, then add chopped onions and cook until translucent. 3. Add finely chopped vegetables and stir-fry until they are tender. 4. Add soy sauce, salt, and pepper. 5. Remove from heat and let it cool. To Make Fried Momo: 1. Divide the dough into small portions and roll them into thin circles. 2. Place a spoonful of the vegetable filling in the center of each circle. 3. Fold the circle in half, creating a half-moon shape. 4. Pinch and pleat the edges to seal the momo. 5. Heat oil for deep frying. 6. Fry the momo in hot oil until they are golden brown and crispy. 7. Drain on paper towels. 8. Serve hot with dipping sauce.

Ingredients: 200g egg noodles; 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, bell peppers, cabbage); 200g cooked chicken, shrimp, or tofu (optional); 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1 tablespoon vegetable oil; 2 tablespoons soy sauce; 1 tablespoon oyster sauce; Salt and pepper to taste
Process: 1. Cook the egg noodles according to package instructions, drain, and set aside. 2. Heat vegetable oil in a pan or wok over high heat. 3. Add minced garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds. 4. Add mixed vegetables and cooked protein (chicken, shrimp, or tofu). Stir-fry for a few minutes until vegetables are tender. 5. Add the cooked noodles to the pan. 6. Add soy sauce and oyster sauce, then toss everything together. 7. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 8. Serve hot.

Ingredients: 2 large eggs; 2 tortilla wraps; 1/2 cup cooked and sliced vegetables (bell peppers, onions, and tomatoes); 1/4 cup shredded cheese (optional); Salt and pepper to taste; 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
Process: 1. Beat the eggs in a bowl and season with salt and pepper. 2. Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. 3. Pour the beaten eggs into the pan and scramble them. 4. Place a tortilla wrap on a clean surface. 5. Layer the scrambled eggs, cooked vegetables, and shredded cheese (if desired) on the wrap. 6. Roll up the tortilla, tucking in the sides as you go. 7. Serve warm.

Ingredients: 1 cup cooked and shredded chicken; 2 tortilla wraps; 1/4 cup sliced lettuce; 1/4 cup diced tomatoes; 1/4 cup diced onions; 1/4 cup mayonnaise; 1/4 cup hot sauce (adjust to taste); Salt and pepper to taste
Process: 1. In a bowl, combine the shredded chicken, mayonnaise, hot sauce, salt, and pepper. 2. Lay out the tortilla wraps on a clean surface. 3. Spread the chicken mixture evenly over the wraps. 4. Add lettuce, diced tomatoes, and diced onions. 5. Roll up the tortillas, tucking in the sides as you go. 6. Serve immediately.

Ingredients: 200g paneer (cottage cheese), cut into strips; 2 tortilla wraps; 1/4 cup sliced bell peppers (assorted colors); 1/4 cup sliced onions; 1/4 cup yogurt; 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; Salt and pepper to taste; 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
Process: 1. Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. 2. Add paneer strips and sauté until they turn golden brown. 3. Add sliced bell peppers and onions. Cook until they are slightly tender. 4. In a bowl, mix yogurt, cumin powder, garam masala, salt, and pepper. 5. Spread the yogurt mixture over the tortilla wraps. 6. Add the cooked paneer, bell peppers, and onions. 7. Roll up the tortillas, tucking in the sides as you go. 8. Serve warm.

Ingredients: 200g pasta (spaghetti, penne, or your choice); 2 tablespoons olive oil; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1/4 cup diced onions; 1/2 cup diced tomatoes; 1/4 cup tomato sauce; 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano; 1/2 teaspoon dried basil; Salt and pepper to taste; Grated Parmesan cheese for garnish
Process: 1. Cook the pasta according to package instructions, drain, and set aside. 2. Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat. 3. Add minced garlic and diced onions. Sauté until onions are translucent. 4. Stir in diced tomatoes and cook for a few minutes until they soften. 5. Add tomato sauce, dried oregano, dried basil, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 5-10 minutes. 6. Toss the cooked pasta in the sauce until well coated. 7. Garnish with grated Parmesan cheese. 8. Serve hot.

Ingredients: 200g boneless fish fillets, boiled and flaked; 2 potatoes, boiled and mashed; 1/4 cup finely chopped onions; 1/4 cup finely chopped bell peppers; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1 teaspoon ginger, minced; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; Salt and pepper to taste; Bread crumbs for coating; Vegetable oil for frying
Process: 1. In a bowl, combine boiled and flaked fish, mashed potatoes, chopped onions, chopped bell peppers, minced garlic, minced ginger, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, salt, and pepper. 2. Mix well to form a dough-like mixture. 3. Shape the mixture into small patties. 4. Roll the patties in bread crumbs to coat them evenly. 5. Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. 6. Fry the fish cutlets until they are golden brown on both sides. 7. Drain excess oil on paper towels. 8. Serve hot.

Ingredients: 200g ground chicken; 1/4 cup finely chopped onions; 1/4 cup finely chopped bell peppers; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1 teaspoon ginger, minced; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; Salt and pepper to taste; Bread crumbs for coating; Vegetable oil for frying
Process: 1. In a bowl, combine ground chicken, chopped onions, chopped bell peppers, minced garlic, minced ginger, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, salt, and pepper. 2. Mix well to form a dough-like mixture. 3. Shape the mixture into small patties. 4. Roll the patties in bread crumbs to coat them evenly. 5. Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. 6. Fry the chicken chops until they are golden brown on both sides. 7. Drain excess oil on paper towels. 8. Serve hot.

Ingredients: 1/2 cup rice; 4 cups milk; 1/2 cup sugar; A pinch of saffron strands; 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder; Chopped nuts and raisins for garnish
Process: 1. Wash and rinse the rice. 2. In a heavy-bottomed pan, bring the milk to a boil. 3. Add the rice and simmer on low heat until the rice is cooked and the mixture thickens. Stir occasionally. 4. Add sugar, saffron strands, and cardamom powder. Cook for a few more minutes. 5. Remove from heat and let it cool. 6. Garnish with chopped nuts and raisins. 7. Serve chilled.

Ingredients: 2 cups diced potatoes; 1/2 cup diced onions; 1/2 cup diced tomatoes; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1 teaspoon ginger, minced; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder; 1/2 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; Salt to taste; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: 1. Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. 2. Add diced potatoes and sauté until they start to turn golden brown. 3. Add diced onions and cook until they become translucent. 4. Stir in minced garlic and minced ginger. Cook for a minute. 5. Add diced tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. 6. Add turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. 7. Add water and simmer until the potatoes are tender and the gravy thickens. 8. Garnish with chopped cilantro. 9. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: 2 cups cauliflower florets; 1/2 cup diced onions; 1/2 cup diced tomatoes; 2 cloves garlic, minced; 1 teaspoon ginger, minced; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder; 1/2 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1/2 teaspoon garam masala; Salt to taste; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Chopped cilantro for garnish

Ingredients: 250g okra (vandir); 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 1 teaspoon mustard seeds; 1 teaspoon cumin seeds; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: 1. Wash and trim the ends of the okra. 2. Heat vegetable oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter. 3. Add cumin seeds and sauté for a minute. 4. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 5. Stir in turmeric powder and red chili powder. 6. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. 7. Add okra and salt. Cook for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until okra is tender. 8. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot with rice.

Ingredients: 4 potatoes, diced; 1/2 cup poppy seeds (posto); 2-3 green chilies, chopped; 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 2 tablespoons mustard oil; Salt to taste;
Process: 1. Soak poppy seeds in water for 2 hours and then grind them into a paste. 2. Heat mustard oil in a pan. 3. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter. 4. Stir in diced potatoes and turmeric powder. 5. Sauté for a few minutes. 6. Add poppy seed paste, green chilies, and salt. 7. Cook until the potatoes are tender and the poppy seed paste thickens. 8. Serve with rice.

Ingredients: 4 pieces of katla fish; 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 1 teaspoon ginger garlic paste; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon cumin powder; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds; 2 tablespoons mustard oil; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: 1. Heat mustard oil in a pan until it smokes. 2. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter. 3. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 4. Stir in ginger garlic paste and cook for a minute. 5. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. 6. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. 7. Cook for a few minutes. 8. Add katla fish pieces and cook until the fish is done. 9. Garnish with chopped cilantro. 10. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Ingredients: 2 cups raw papaya, peeled and diced; 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 1 teaspoon ginger garlic paste; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: 1. Heat vegetable oil in a pan. 2. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. 3. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 4. Stir in ginger garlic paste and cook for a minute. 5. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. 6. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. 7. Add diced papaya and cook until tender. 8. Garnish with chopped cilantro. 9. Serve with rice or roti.

Ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, peas, potatoes), diced; 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 1 teaspoon ginger garlic paste; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon cumin powder; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: 1. Heat vegetable oil in a pan. 2. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 3. Stir in ginger garlic paste and cook for a minute. 4. Garnish with chopped cilantro. 8. Serve with rice or roti.

Ingredients: 1 cup shrimp, cleaned and deveined; 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 1 teaspoon ginger garlic paste; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon cumin powder; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: 1. Heat vegetable oil in a pan. 2. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 3. Stir in ginger garlic paste and cook for a minute. 4. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. 5. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. 6. Add cleaned shrimp and cook until they turn pink and opaque. 7. Garnish with chopped cilantro. 8. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Ingredients: 1 pound mutton pieces; 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 1 teaspoon ginger garlic paste; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder; 1 teaspoon cumin powder; 1 teaspoon coriander powder; 2 tablespoons vegetable oil; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: 1. Heat vegetable oil in a pressure cooker. 2. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 3. Stir in ginger garlic paste and cook for a minute. 4. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. 5. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. 6. Add mutton pieces and cook until they are browned on all sides. 7. Add enough water to cover the mutton, close the pressure cooker, and cook until the mutton is tender (about 4-5 whistles). 8. Garnish with chopped cilantro. 9. Serve hot with rice or naan.

Ingredients: 1 cup rice; 1/2 cup split yellow lentils (moong dal); 1 onion, finely chopped; 2 tomatoes, chopped; 1 teaspoon ginger garlic paste; 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder; 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds; 2 tablespoons ghee; Salt to taste; Chopped cilantro for garnish
Process: 1. Rinse rice and moong dal together and soak in water for 30 minutes. 2. Heat ghee in a pressure cooker. 3. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. 4. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 5. Stir in ginger garlic paste and cook for a minute. 6. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft. 7. Add turmeric powder and salt. 8. Drain the soaked rice and dal and add them to the pressure cooker. 9. Add enough water to cover the rice and dal mixture. 10. Close the pressure cooker and cook until you hear 3-4 whistles. 11. Garnish with chopped cilantro. 12. Serve hot.

Ingredients: For the Crepes: 1 cup rice flour; 1/2 cup all-purpose flour; 1/2 cup semolina (sooji); 1/2 cup milk; 1/2 cup water; For the Filling: 1 cup grated coconut; 1 cup jaggery, grated; 1/2 teaspoon cardamom powder; Ghee for cooking
Process: For the Crepes: 1. In a bowl, combine rice flour, all-purpose flour, semolina, milk, and water to make a batter. 2. Heat a non-stick pan and spread ghee on it. 3. Pour a ladleful of the batter onto the pan and spread it in a circular motion to make thin crepes. 4. Cook until they turn golden brown on both sides. 5. For the Filling: 1. In a pan, melt the grated jaggery with a little water to make a syrup. 2. Add grated coconut and cardamom powder to the syrup. 3. Cook until the mixture thickens. 4. Place a spoonful of the filling on each crepe and roll them up. 5. Serve warm.

Ingredients: 2 cups heavy cream; 1 cup whole milk; 1 cup sugar; 2 teaspoons vanilla extract; Your choice of flavorings (chocolate chips, fruit puree, etc.);
Process: 1. In a bowl, whisk together heavy cream and sugar until the sugar is dissolved. 2. Add whole milk and vanilla extract. 3. Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions. 4. During the last few minutes of churning, add your choice of flavorings. 5. Transfer the ice cream to an airtight container and freeze for several hours until firm. 6. Serve scoops of ice cream in bowls or cones.

Ingredients: For the Dough: 1 cup all-purpose flour; 2 tablespoons ghee; Water for kneading; For the Filling: 1/2 cup khoya (milk solids); 2 tablespoons powdered sugar; A few raisins and chopped nuts; For the Sugar Syrup: 1 cup sugar; 1/2 cup water; A few drops of rose essence; Oil for frying;
Process: For the Dough: 1. Mix all-purpose flour and ghee in a bowl. 2. Add water gradually and knead into a soft dough. 3. Cover and let it rest for 30 minutes. For the Filling: 1. Mix khoya, powdered sugar, raisins, and chopped nuts in a bowl. For the Sugar Syrup: 1. Prepare a sugar syrup by boiling sugar and water until it reaches a one-string consistency. 2. Add rose essence to the syrup. For Making Lobongo Lotika: 1. Roll out small portions of the dough into thin circles. 2. Place a portion of the filling in the center of each circle. 3. Fold the dough over the filling to make a half-moon shape. 4. Seal the edges by pressing with the tines of a fork. 5. Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the lobongo lotikas until golden brown. 6. Remove from oil and immediately dip them in the sugar syrup. 7. Let them soak for a few minutes. 8. Serve once they cool down.

Ingredients: 1 cup roasted gram (bhuna chana); 1/2 cup peanuts; 1/2 cup sev (crispy chickpea noodles); 1/2 cup roasted poha (flattened rice); 1/2 cup fried curry leaves; 1/2 cup fried green chilies; 1/2 cup fried cashews; 1/2 cup fried raisins; 1/2 cup roasted masoor dal (split red lentils); 1/2 cup roasted moong dal (split yellow lentils); 1/2 cup roasted chana dal (split chickpeas); 1/2 cup roasted peanuts; 1/2 cup roasted sunflower seeds; 1 teaspoon red chili powder; 1/2 teaspoon chaat masala; 1/2 teaspoon black salt; 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder; 1/2 teaspoon coriander powder; 1/2 teaspoon amchur (dried mango) powder; 1/2 teaspoon sugar; 1/4 cup vegetable oil; Salt to taste
Process: 1. In a large mixing bowl, combine roasted gram, peanuts, sev, roasted poha, fried curry leaves, fried green chilies, fried cashews, fried raisins, roasted masoor dal, roasted moong dal, roasted chana dal, roasted peanuts, and roasted sunflower seeds. 2. Add red chili powder, chaat masala, black salt, cumin powder, coriander powder, amchur powder, sugar, and salt. 3. Mix everything together until well combined. 4. Store in an airtight container. 5. Enjoy as a spicy and crunchy snack!
